announce.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to officially tell people about something, especially about a plan or a decision
announce.translation[0].definitions[0].e: They announced their engagement in ‘The Times’.
At the end of their meeting, it was announced that an agreement had been reached.
The government has announced plans to create 10,000 new jobs.
A government spokesman announced that the hostages had been released.
Cordon announced his resignation to staff members on Wednesday.
announce.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to say something, especially something that other people will not like, in a loud and confident way
announce.translation[0].definitions[1].e: ‘I’m not going to their party, ’ Maggie announced.
He stood up and announced that he was ready to go.
announce.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to give information to people using a loudspeaker or microphone, especially at an airport or railway station
announce.translation[0].definitions[2].e: We arrived just as they were announcing the arrival of Flight 207 from Minneapolis.
announce.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to introduce a programme on television or radio
